header.title: THE CHT <1>INDIGENOUS</1> WOMANIFESTO
header.description: Empowering indigenous women and communities to rise against systemic oppression, reclaim their voices

hero.title: PROTEST FOR EQUALITY
hero.description: Empowering indigenous women and communities to rise against systemic oppression, reclaim their voices

whoweare.title: WHO WE ARE
whoweare.description: SPaRC is an indigenous women-led feminist organisation established in Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT), Bangladesh. SPaRC works with a specific focus for indigenous women, girls and communities who are often ignored, have no access to resources and are survivors of communal attack, conflict, Violence Against Women, Gender Based Violence, and systematic oppression such as misinformation, intergenerational trauma and sufferings.

whatwestandfor.title: WHAT WE STAND FOR
whatwestandfor.description: To ensure women and girls' social, cultural, economic and political, sexual and spiritual rights without prejudice of any identity such as age, sex, caste, religion, ethnicity or sexual orientation etc.

whatweareheaded.title: WHERE WE ARE HEADED
whatweareheaded.description: To create a world where all living beings enjoy their rights with dignity.

whatwedo.title: WHAT WE DO
whatwedo.description: To create a world where all living beings enjoy their rights with dignity.

team.description: Strong voices. Bold visions. Meet the women and allies driving equality and empowerment forward. Our strength lies in unity. ourstory.title: WHO WE ARE
ourstory.description: SPaRC is an indigenous women-led feminist organisation established in Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT), Bangladesh. SPaRC works with a specific focus for indigenous women, girls and communities who are often ignored, have no access to resources and are survivors of communal attack, conflict, Violence Against Women, Gender Based Violence, and systematic oppression such as misinformation, intergenerational trauma and sufferings.

hero_section.title: Apply today to become a <1>volunteer</1>
hero_section.description: Every action counts when it comes to protecting the rights, voices, and dignity of Indigenous women. By volunteering with us

why_volunteer_section.title: WHY VOLUNTEERS WITH US?
why_volunteer_section.description: Empowerment begins with awareness — and change begins with you. As a volunteer, you'll help raise voices that deserve to be heard, support community-led initiatives, and advocate for justice, education, and equality for Indigenous women.
why_volunteer_section.subtitle: Through your time and passion, you can help:
list: Support community workshops and awareness programs
Organize campaigns on women's rights and cultural preservation
Share stories that inspire change across generations

gain_section.title: WHAT YOU'LL GAIN
gain_section.description: Volunteering isn't just an act of service — it's a journey of learning, connection, and growth. You'll work alongside dedicated leaders, experience Indigenous cultures firsthand, and become a voice for those who continue to fight for equality and recognition.
gain_section.subtitle: You'll gain:
list: Real experience in advocacy and social impact work
Deeper understanding of Indigenous traditions and resilience
A sense of purpose and community that lasts a lifetime

top_section.title: BE PART OF REAL <1>CHANGE</1>

career_journey_section.description_part2: Skill-building sessions that provide education, leadership training, and emotional support to Indigenous women in local communities. top_section.title: THE FELLOWSHIP IS OPEN TO <1>INDIGENOUS</1> YOUTH
top_section.description: Our Fellowship Program supports individuals dedicated to protecting Indigenous rights, documenting histories, and building stronger communities.

hero_section.title: FELLOWSHIP
hero_section.description: Gain hands-on experience and make an impact through our internship program.

about_section.title: ABOUT THE FELLOWSHIP
about_section.description: This fellowship provides mentorship, training, and funding to individuals passionate about cultural heritage, gender equity, environmental justice, and Indigenous education. To help address these challenges, our Early Career Fellowship empowers a new, diverse generation of Internet champions who will bridge the gap between technology and policy, becoming advocates for the open, globally connected, secure, and trustworthy Internet.

program_section.title: ABOUT THE PROGRAM
program_section.description: The Indigenous Fellowship Program is designed to empower emerging leaders from Indigenous communities through mentorship, research support, and cultural advocacy training. The program provides fellows with the resources and guidance needed to preserve traditional knowledge, document community histories, and lead initiatives that strengthen Indigenous rights and representation. Through collaboration, storytelling, and field-based projects, fellows contribute to building a more inclusive and equitable future for their people.

eligibility_section.title: WHO IS ELIGIBLE TO APPLY?
eligibility_section.description: The fellowship is open to Indigenous individuals who are passionate about community development, cultural preservation, and social advocacy.
eligibility_section.subtitle: Candidates with the following are welcome to apply:
requirements: Must have a demonstrated commitment to community service or research

hero_section.title: HOW TO PARTNER
hero_section.description: Our research amplifies Indigenous voices, documents cultural wisdom, and supports evidence-based advocacy for equality and sustainability

step_1.heading: Submit a Partnership Proposal
step_1.description: Share your organization's goals and areas of interest. We welcome proposals supporting advocacy, education, gender equality, and cultural sustainability.

step_2.heading: Consultation & Review
step_2.description: Our team carefully reviews each proposal in discussion with Indigenous community representatives to ensure cultural relevance and mutual benefit.

step_3.heading: Agreement & Implementation
step_3.description: Once approved, we sign a formal agreement and begin collaborative action — from research and workshops to community programs.

list.title: Institutional Partnerships
list.description: Collaborate on advocacy campaigns, cultural research, or educational programs.

list.title: Funding & Grants
list.description: Support ongoing or new Indigenous-led projects through financial partnerships and co-funding

list.title: Academic & Research Collaboration
list.description: Partner with universities, researchers, and think tanks to produce evidence-based studies on Indigenous issues.
